column4: hi I need to install linux-headers-2.6.24-20 but it is no longer available anywhere
why should you need headers for a kernel that you don't have installed ?
because I have it installed
sudo apt-get install  linux-headers-$(uname -r)
package ...yadayada.... has no candidates to install
check that you have the standard repositories enabled
all of them. sources included
what can I do
can't help, i am not using hardy  :\
ah, you are using an unsupport configuration, the linux headers package for that version is available on the hardy repos, not on intrepid
I would like to use the new kernel but it just does not work
it does not boot
stuck, frozen
I would like to file a bug but it's 99% useless. When a kernel is not good for your system, it will never be
well, if you file a bug during development it is likely to get some attention and fixed
I dunno if it's a bug
kernels are not bad for any particular system, on your case it's a regression, since you had a working kernel, so you should have filed a bug
I see no errors, just freeze
if you can boot with hardy but not with intrepid, it's a bug
is there any log I can investigate and post to the dev's
otherwise just saying "er, it does not work" is useless for them
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingProcedures#Kernel
well, digital photos are ok . I see
